projects.title: Enchanted Rose Innovations
projects.description: This is the web application that describes the business, and the core values I stick too when doing independent work. While also providing me a backend interface to manage my projects deployed on digital ocean. It is built in React, NextJS, and TailwindCSS, leveraging the use of the Digital Ocean API, as well as getting diagnostics of currently deployed applications via their own respective API's.

projects.title: Acolyte R.E.A.L.M.S.
projects.description: This is my Magnum Opus, the project born out of the request made when I formed Enchanted Rose Innovations. A Remote Engagement and Learning Management System designed and programmed entirely by myself. It has undergone many iterations and version 4 is currently in use, version 5 is in active development and is scheduled for release in early 2025.

projects.title: un-Traditional Magick
projects.description: This is my first client where I re-designed the front end of their website, and they used Acolyte v4 until recently. While currently on haitus I keep them as a reference for posterity.

projects.title: Project Alchemist
projects.description: This is an Add-On to Acolyte, the goal of this project is to be an LLM that is developed and trained in-house that has the ability to learn from the content placed into Acolyte and have the ability to make content suggestions and answer students questions.

projects.title: Project Blue Rose
projects.description: This is a desktop application made to help set up initial project scaffolding and development environments using Docker, that way no dependencies are left behind or forgotten about when starting new projects.

projects.title: A Warrior's Journey
projects.description: In the beginning of 2024 I set a goal for myself to write my life story to date. I've written poetry for years, and when faced with this task I decided to turn the story into a series of poems starting from early childhood to my positive outlook on life now. After many nights writing I finally had a draft and upon reading it made the bold decision to publish it for anyone to see. I aquired and ISBN Number and started the work of publishing through Barnes & Nobel Press. I am currently waiting on my Author's copy and once I have reviewed the print quality I plan on approving the design and listing it for sale on Barnes & Nobel, Amazon, and donating a few copies to some local libraries here in Seattle. Once the item is listed I will place a link to my author profile in the top with the Github, Spotify, etc links as well as in this section here..
